intro: Merkusia angulata, commonly known as the angular merkusia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive angular leaf shape. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Merkusia angulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
